neighbors.name: Village Of Roxana

neighbors.name: Campbell David and Laura
neighbors.claims: A David E. Campbell at a Wood River address cast a ballot in the 2020 general election ([metroeastsun.com](https://metroeastsun.com/stories/656823711-how-did-central-s-city-of-wood-river-precinct-wood-river-06-residents-vote-in-2020-presidential-election#:~:text=David%20E.%20Campbell%20%20,Voted)). No evidence of David or Laura Campbell taking public positions or roles was located in local records ([m.riverbender.com](https://m.riverbender.com/news/roxana/index.cfm?currentrow=4#:~:text=No%20,campbell)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a neighborly, informal approach by project representatives, highlighting community benefits and listening to any personal concerns.

neighbors.name: Jockisch Wanda
neighbors.claims: Wanda Jockisch operates a tax preparation business (Actiontax) at 5769 Godfrey Rd in nearby Godfrey, IL ([www.dotax.com](https://www.dotax.com/accountant/illinois/godfrey/wanda-jockisch-dba-actiontax/115452#:~:text=Last%20Updated%3A%2003%2F24%2F2015)). No references to Wanda Jockisch speaking in local government meetings or media were found ([m.riverbender.com](https://m.riverbender.com/news/roxana/index.cfm?currentrow=4#:~:text=No%20,jockisch)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a local business/community leader who can discuss how the project boosts tax revenue and benefits the local economy, aligning with her professional perspective.

neighbors.name: Hayes Tara M
neighbors.claims: Tara M. Hayes is listed as a property owner in Roxana, but she has no public profile in news or civic records ([m.riverbender.com](https://m.riverbender.com/news/roxana/index.cfm?currentrow=4#:~:text=No%20,hayes)). No documented statements or community roles were found under her name as of the latest search ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/legacyremembers/tara-hayes-obituary?id=13146100#:~:text=Flowers%20Make%20a%20Donation%20Share,Tara%20Adamma%20Hayes%20Send%20Flowers)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with a direct, friendly conversation by a community relations representative, offering information and addressing any questions in a one-on-one setting.

neighbors.name: Michael R. Johnson & Vickie J. Johnson
neighbors.claims: Vickie Johnson is a Title I reading teacher at Roxana’s Central Intermediate School【27†L23-L26; "Title I Reading Teacher at Central Intermediate School in Roxana"】 and also serves as a trustee on the Roxana Public Library Board【8†L2-L6; "Roxana Village Library Board"】. Mike Johnson retired from being Director of Counseling at Granite City School District #9 and is currently the Academic Advising Coordinator at Southwestern Illinois College【27†L23-L26; "Director of Counseling ... Southwestern Illinois College"】. The Johnsons have been part of the South Roxana community for over 50 years, celebrating their 50th wedding anniversary in 2019【27†L8-L15; "celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary with family and friends"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a fellow educator or local official they respect introduce the project, emphasizing community benefits (e.g. support for schools or library) and inviting their input in a civic-minded discussion.

neighbors.name: Kimberly B. Warren
neighbors.claims: Kimberly “Kim” Warren is the founder of **Animal Warriors Roxana**, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit that assists local pets and their families with vet care, food and shelter【53†L25-L33; "helps pets and their families in need"】. She organizes community events like the annual “Pawty in the Park” at Roxana Park, which drew around 500 attendees in 2022【53†L16-L24; "We're expecting around 500 people,"】. Warren emphasizes community cooperation; for example, she noted that “it truly takes a village” to achieve local initiatives【52†L19-L27; "It truly takes a village, and our community is a wonderful example of how working together only makes us all stronger."】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her through community networks and highlight the project’s local benefits. Acknowledge her volunteer efforts and address any questions about environmental or animal impacts to align with causes she cares about.

neighbors.name: Chastity Niemeyer
neighbors.claims: Chastity Niemeyer, a Wood River native, co-owns **Charlie’s Drive-In**, a 1950s-era root beer stand that she helped revive in 2022 after it had closed the previous year【21†L13-L16; "will reopen under the ownership of Chastity Niemeyer, a Wood River native"】. She has extensive restaurant experience, having managed her in-laws’ three 3rd Chute Bar & Grill locations for six years【21†L39-L42; "her in-laws are the owners of 3rd Chute Bar and Grill… managing all three locations for the past six years"】. Niemeyer calls Charlie’s a “little hometown gem” and has pledged to put her “heart and soul” into maintaining it for the community【21†L56-L59; "We will put our heart and soul into this little hometown gem,"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect with her via local business circles and emphasize any positive economic ripple effects of the project. A personal visit (perhaps at her restaurant) to discuss how the development might support local commerce or community traditions could foster goodwill.

neighbors.name: Tara Lynn Yon & Matthew J. Yon
neighbors.claims: No significant public information was found regarding Tara or Matthew Yon beyond their ownership of this parcel【96†L0-L0; "No `find` results for pattern: `yon`"】. They are not mentioned in local news archives or civic records, and have no recorded involvement in community affairs as of this date【96†L0-L0; "No `find` results for pattern: `yon`"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a low-key, personal approach. Since the Yons are private, a friendly one-on-one introduction explaining the project and listening to any of their concerns in a neighborly setting would be advisable.

neighbors.name: Dale E. Carroll & Joanne Carroll
neighbors.claims: Dale and Joanne Carroll own two parcels in the Roxana vicinity, but no public profile or occupational details could be discovered beyond their property ownership【100†L0-L0; "No `find` results for pattern: `carroll`"】. They do not appear in local news, civic minutes, or any documented community activities, indicating no visible involvement in public affairs【100†L0-L0; "No `find` results for pattern: `carroll`"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the Carrolls quietly and respectfully. Given their private nature, a direct visit by a trusted local figure to explain the project and address any concerns on a personal level would likely be the most effective strategy.

neighbors.name: Joann E. Spann
neighbors.claims: Joann E. Spann owns a residential parcel in the Wood River Township area of Roxana (near East 8th Street) ([www.scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/document/691260247/Madison-County-Surplus-Property-1#:~:text=ITEM%20PARCEL%20NUMBER%20TOWNSHIP%20LOT,SIZE%20Madison%20County)). No evidence was found of her holding any public office or making statements on local development issues ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/Six-seek-three-Roxana-Village-Board-seats-12661806.php#:~:text=town%27s%20former%20mayor%2C%20are%20seeking,seats%20on%20the%20Village%20Board)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private homeowner; no public civic role

approach_recommendations.engage: A personal, neighborly approach is recommended – meet at her residence to listen to any concerns and emphasize how the project will respect neighborhood quiet and property values.

neighbors.name: John P. Segrest
neighbors.claims: John P. Segrest is the listed owner of a Roxana-area residential lot (Madison County PIN 19-2-08-34-12-203-012) in the same East 8th Street vicinity ([www.scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/document/691260247/Madison-County-Surplus-Property-1#:~:text=ITEM%20PARCEL%20NUMBER%20TOWNSHIP%20LOT,SIZE%20Madison%20County)). His name does not appear in local news archives or civic records, indicating no known public stance or roles in community affairs ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/Six-seek-three-Roxana-Village-Board-seats-12661806.php#:~:text=town%27s%20former%20mayor%2C%20are%20seeking,seats%20on%20the%20Village%20Board)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage him in an informal conversation at his home to understand any personal concerns. Emphasize transparency about the development and address common homeowner questions (e.g., property upkeep, traffic).

neighbors.name: William A. Forrester
neighbors.claims: William A. Forrester owns property in the immediate project area, recorded as a residential parcel in Roxana’s Wood River Township sector ([www.scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/document/691260247/Madison-County-Surplus-Property-1#:~:text=ITEM%20PARCEL%20NUMBER%20TOWNSHIP%20LOT,SIZE%20Madison%20County)). There are no public records of Forrester participating in local government or voicing opinions on development; his name is absent from local meeting minutes and news reports ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/Six-seek-three-Roxana-Village-Board-seats-12661806.php#:~:text=town%27s%20former%20mayor%2C%20are%20seeking,seats%20on%20the%20Village%20Board)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local resident; not known in civic sphere

approach_recommendations.engage: A courteous one-on-one approach focusing on information-sharing is advised. Highlight how the development plans will be mindful of the neighborhood’s character, and invite his feedback or questions.

neighbors.name: G. Craig Caldwell
neighbors.claims: G. Craig Caldwell (listed with first initial "G") is identified as owner of a residential parcel near E. 8th St. in Roxana ([www.scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/document/691260247/Madison-County-Surplus-Property-1#:~:text=ITEM%20PARCEL%20NUMBER%20TOWNSHIP%20LOT,SIZE%20Madison%20County)). The Caldwell family name has appeared in Roxana for decades ([www.e-yearbook.com](https://www.e-yearbook.com/yearbooks/Roxana_High_School_Rox_Yearbook/1969/Page_1.html#:~:text=National%20Honor%20Society%204,Honor%20Society%203%2C4%2C%20President%204)), but no evidence shows Craig Caldwell himself in any official role or making public comments on development ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/Six-seek-three-Roxana-Village-Board-seats-12661806.php#:~:text=town%27s%20former%20mayor%2C%20are%20seeking,seats%20on%20the%20Village%20Board)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime local family; no formal influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect through shared community context – e.g., mentioning local events or history – to build rapport. Approach with respect for his family’s long ties to the area, and provide clear details to address any questions about project impacts.

neighbors.name: Evelyn E. Harrison
neighbors.claims: Evelyn E. Harrison was a longtime area resident (b.1926) who passed away in 2020 at age 93 ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thetelegraph/name/evelyn-harrison-obituary?id=16436123#:~:text=ROXANA%20%E2%80%94%20Evelyn%20E,Anthony%27s%20Hospital%20in%20Alton)). She worked as a nurse’s aide at Wood River Township Hospital until retirement in 1986 ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thetelegraph/name/evelyn-harrison-obituary?id=16436123#:~:text=Evelyn%20worked%20as%20a%20nurse%27s,of%20the%20VFW%20Ladies%27%20Auxiliary)), and was active in local social organizations like the Wood River Eagles (and a VFW Auxiliary while living in Arizona) ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thetelegraph/name/evelyn-harrison-obituary?id=16436123#:~:text=Evelyn%20worked%20as%20a%20nurse%27s,of%20the%20VFW%20Ladies%27%20Auxiliary)). Her estate still holds her property, and one of her sons resides in Roxana ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thetelegraph/name/evelyn-harrison-obituary?id=16436123#:~:text=Survivors%20include%20three%20sons%2C%20Keith,and%20Danny%3B%20and%208%20great)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Elderly longtime resident; no formal civic role

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via her family (contact her son in Roxana as representative). Emphasize respect for the family’s long-standing presence and assure that the project will honor the community’s well-being.

neighbors.name: Brian Brake
neighbors.claims: Brian Brake is listed as an owner of a Roxana parcel but has no evident public profile or civic roles ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/Brake-12690810.php#:~:text=News%20,Curtis%20Martin%20officiated)). No references to him in local news or government records were found, suggesting he is a private resident with no noted public stance ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/Brake-12690810.php#:~:text=News%20,Curtis%20Martin%20officiated)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with a friendly, informal introduction to learn his views, as he has no known stance or affiliations.

neighbors.name: Edward Bazzell
neighbors.claims: Edward Bazzell appears to be a private landowner with no mentions in local media or civic records ([metroeastsun.com](https://metroeastsun.com/stories/650706048-recent-madison-county-home-sales-in-week-ending-june-10#:~:text=Buyer%3A%20Ethan%20C,Bazzell%20Seller%3A%20Suzanne%20Johnes)). His surname is present in the area (e.g., other Bazzell family real estate activity) but no public activities or statements by Edward were found ([metroeastsun.com](https://metroeastsun.com/stories/650706048-recent-madison-county-home-sales-in-week-ending-june-10#:~:text=Buyer%3A%20Ethan%20C,Bazzell%20Seller%3A%20Suzanne%20Johnes)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage one-on-one through a casual conversation by a community liaison, focusing on listening to any concerns since he’s not publicly outspoken.

neighbors.name: Rue Foe
neighbors.claims: Rue Foe had a career in local education, noted as an assistant principal in a high school during the 1970s ([www.newspapers.com](https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/26507563/#:~:text=The%20board%20also%20voted%20to,day)). No recent public statements or community positions by Foe on development or energy issues could be identified in available records ([royaldutchshellplc.com](https://royaldutchshellplc.com/2011/06/09/roxana-residents-assail-shell-over-benzene-worries/?nb=1&share=print#:~:text=residents%20who%20wanted%20to%20hire,his%20firm%20in%20the%20matter)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Highlight educational and community benefits when reaching out. A respected former educator may respond well to outreach that references local schools or youth.

neighbors.name: Robert D. Farris
neighbors.claims: Robert D. Farris of Roxana was involved in a 2014 incident in which his wife Sandra was tragically killed in a vehicle accident ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/Roxana-woman-killed-in-La-crash-12647913.php#:~:text=David%20says%20the%20accident%20occurred,that%20held%20two%20large%20propellers)). Aside from this personal event, Farris has not been noted in public local affairs or taken any visible stance on development issues ([royaldutchshellplc.com](https://royaldutchshellplc.com/2011/06/09/roxana-residents-assail-shell-over-benzene-worries/?nb=1&share=print#:~:text=residents%20who%20wanted%20to%20hire,his%20firm%20in%20the%20matter)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a considerate, empathetic approach via a personal visit or call. Emphasize listening to his priorities, as he has remained privately in the community without public positions.

neighbors.name: Robin E. Staggs and Matthew E. Staggs
neighbors.claims: Robin E. and Matthew E. Staggs are co-owners of a residential parcel in Roxana, and no record of any public roles or statements by them was found ([metroeastsun.com](https://metroeastsun.com/stories/650706048-recent-madison-county-home-sales-in-week-ending-june-10#:~:text=514%20Logan%20St.%2015%20,Maricela%20Williams%20Seller%3A%20Rachel%20Staggs)). The Staggs name appears in area property transactions (e.g., a recent sale by a different Staggs), but this couple has no evident public profile ([metroeastsun.com](https://metroeastsun.com/stories/650706048-recent-madison-county-home-sales-in-week-ending-june-10#:~:text=514%20Logan%20St.%2015%20,Maricela%20Williams%20Seller%3A%20Rachel%20Staggs)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out as neighbors through a community open house or informal meeting. With no known activism, focus on building rapport and understanding their general concerns.

neighbors.name: James K. Conn and Danielle Messinger
neighbors.claims: James K. Conn and Danielle Messinger are listed as co-owners of a residential parcel in Roxana, Illinois (Madison County PIN 19-2-08-34-08-206-016) ([publicrecords.netronline.com](https://publicrecords.netronline.com/state/IL/county/madison#:~:text=Madison%20Assessor)). No available record in local news or meeting minutes shows Conn or Messinger taking public positions on development issues as of Dec 2025 ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/South-Roxana-residents-voice-drainage-concerns-at-12712536.php#:~:text=EDWARDSVILLE%20%E2%80%94%20Two%20South%20Roxana,any%20money%20available%20for%20projects)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a friendly, personal outreach to introduce the project and address any basic property or neighborhood concerns. Emphasize listening and transparency to build trust.

neighbors.name: Damon Vest and Linda Vest
neighbors.claims: Damon Vest and his wife Linda Vest are identified as owners of a property in the village of Roxana, Madison County ([publicrecords.netronline.com](https://publicrecords.netronline.com/state/IL/county/madison#:~:text=Madison%20Assessor)). No evidence was found of the Vests participating in community meetings or voicing opinions on local development proposals ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/South-Roxana-residents-voice-drainage-concerns-at-12712536.php#:~:text=EDWARDSVILLE%20%E2%80%94%20Two%20South%20Roxana,any%20money%20available%20for%20projects)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through informal, neighborly contact and provide clear information about the project. Given their low public profile, focus on respectful communication and invite questions or concerns.

neighbors.name: Camilla Gordon
neighbors.claims: County property records list Camilla Gordon as the owner of a parcel in Roxana, IL ([publicrecords.netronline.com](https://publicrecords.netronline.com/state/IL/county/madison#:~:text=Madison%20Assessor)). There are no public records or media reports indicating that Gordon has taken any stance or active role regarding local development or energy projects ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/South-Roxana-residents-voice-drainage-concerns-at-12712536.php#:~:text=EDWARDSVILLE%20%E2%80%94%20Two%20South%20Roxana,any%20money%20available%20for%20projects)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate contact in a polite, personal manner to explain the project details. Since Gordon has no noted public stance, ensure the discussion addresses general community benefits and any potential personal impacts.

neighbors.name: Wrb Refining Llc
neighbors.claims: WRB Refining LP (a Phillips 66–Cenovus joint venture) operates the Wood River Refinery in Roxana, Illinois, a 2,200-acre facility processing ~356,500 barrels of oil per day [Portfolio+ — company, retrieved 2025-12-08; "jointly owned by Phillips 66 and Cenovus" ([portfolio-pplus.azurewebsites.net](https://portfolio-pplus.azurewebsites.net/SiteMains/Details/425#:~:text=Located%20in%20Roxana%2C%20Illinois%2C%20and,River%20receives%20Canadian%20and%20domestic))](https://portfolio-pplus.azurewebsites.net/SiteMains/Details/425) [Reuters — news, retrieved 2025-12-08; "total capacity of 356,500 barrels per day" ([www.reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/planned-turnaround-ongoing-phillips-66s-wood-river-refinery-iir-says-2025-03-20/#:~:text=Phillips%2066%27s%20Wood%20River%20refinery%2C,bpd%20vacuum))](https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/planned-turnaround-ongoing-phillips-66s-wood-river-refinery-iir-says-2025-03-20/). In 2012, local taxing bodies (including Roxana CUSD 1 and Roxana Park District) sued to prevent WRB from obtaining property tax exemptions by classifying ~$3 billion in new refinery equipment as pollution control facilities [Illinois Appellate Court — court, retrieved 2025-12-08; "sought the preferential tax treatment of about $3 billion in improvements as pollution control facilities" ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html#:~:text=United%20States%20and%20is%20a,5%20of%20the%20Property))](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html). After years of dispute, a 2024 settlement increased the refinery’s assessed value and commits WRB to pay around $28.7 million per year in local property taxes through 2028 [The Telegraph — news, retrieved 2025-12-08; "Wood River Refinery to pay $28.7 million annually in tax settlement" ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/madison-county-school-district-wood-river-refinery-19822271.php#:~:text=Wood%20River%20Refinery%20to%20pay,million%20annually%20in%20tax%20settlement))](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/madison-county-school-district-wood-river-refinery-19822271.php). Phillips 66 (operator of WRB) also invested over $1.1 million in 2024 to support more than 100 local organizations as part of community engagement efforts [EdGlenToday — news, retrieved 2025-12-08; "supported over 100 local organizations ... invested over $1.1 million in total support" ([m.edglentoday.com](https://m.edglentoday.com/articles/details.cfm?id=78952#:~:text=at%20Lewis%20%26%20Clark%20Junior,1%20million%20in%20total%20support)) ([m.edglentoday.com](https://m.edglentoday.com/articles/details.cfm?id=78952#:~:text=66%20Wood%20River%20Refinery%20supported,1%20million%20in%20total%20support))](https://m.edglentoday.com/articles/details.cfm?id=78952).
neighbors.influence_justification: Controls largest local industry and tax base; major employer; engages extensively in community funding

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Wood River Refinery leadership (via Phillips 66's public affairs liaison) to address any safety or tax concerns; emphasize mutually beneficial community outcomes to align with the company’s public relations and economic priorities

neighbors.name: Midwest Petroleum Company
neighbors.claims: Midwest Petroleum Company (MPC) is a family-owned fuel retailer and distributor founded in 1946 in St. Louis, Missouri ([midwestpetro.com](https://midwestpetro.com/about.php#:~:text=Midwest%20Petroleum%20Company%2C%20commonly%20referred,Louis)), and was purchased by Don McNutt in 1993 ([midwestpetro.com](https://midwestpetro.com/about.php#:~:text=Midwest%20Petroleum%20Company%2C%20commonly%20referred,Louis)). MPC supplies gasoline wholesale and operates convenience store gas stations in the St. Louis/Madison County region ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/FSupp/603/1099/1888566/#:~:text=Louis%2C%20Missouri,having%20their%20principal%20places%20of)). In 2023, Midwest Petroleum opened a new gas station in Wood River, IL, which local officials praised as a welcome boost to economic development ([www.edglentoday.com](https://www.edglentoday.com/articles/details/midwest-petroleum-gas-station-opens-in-wood-river-67641.cfm#:~:text=great%20idea,River%20officials%20were%20present%20as)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Operates a single local gas station; not a major landholder or employer in the area

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage owner Don McNutt directly to ensure the project does not disrupt their gas station operations; emphasize benefits like increased local traffic and coordinate on any construction impacts to maintain good relations

neighbors.name: Roxana Community Unit School Dist 1
neighbors.claims: Roxana Community Unit School District No. 1 (CUSD 1) is a public school district whose budget heavily depends on property taxes from the Wood River Refinery, its single largest taxpayer ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html#:~:text=Roxana%20Community%20Park%20District%3B%20South,of%20about%20%243%20billion%20in)). The district took an active role in opposing any loss of tax revenue: in 2012, Roxana CUSD 1 joined other local bodies in suing to block WRB Refining’s attempt to exempt roughly $3 billion in refinery improvements from taxation via pollution-control status ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html#:~:text=United%20States%20and%20is%20a,5%20of%20the%20Property)). After protracted disputes, a mediated 2024 agreement now guarantees the refinery will pay about $28.7 million annually to the school district and others through 2028 ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/madison-county-school-district-wood-river-refinery-19822271.php#:~:text=Wood%20River%20Refinery%20to%20pay,million%20annually%20in%20tax%20settlement)) ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/madison-county-school-district-wood-river-refinery-19822271.php#:~:text=average%20of%20nearly%20%2428,each%20year)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Key local institution with public support; successfully rallied other agencies to protect its tax base

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Superintendent Debra Kreutztrager and the school board to address any concerns about tax revenue or student safety; consider offering educational programs or revenue-sharing to demonstrate the project’s benefits to the district

neighbors.name: Shell Oil Company
neighbors.claims: Shell Oil Company owned and operated the Wood River Refinery for decades (it founded the facility in 1918 via its Roxana Petroleum subsidiary) and remains involved in the village only to manage legacy pollution from its former operations ([www.offshore-technology.com](https://www.offshore-technology.com/projects/wrbwoodriverfacility/#:~:text=Built%20in%201918%20by%20Shell%2C,July%202007%2C%20operates%20the%20refinery)) ([royaldutchshellplc.com](https://royaldutchshellplc.com/2011/06/09/roxana-residents-assail-shell-over-benzene-worries/?nb=1&share=print#:~:text=The%20benzene%20leak%20has%20been,of%20two%201986%20benzene%20leaks)). The Village of Roxana and residents have sued Shell over benzene contamination; a 2012 lawsuit alleged Shell’s refinery activities left benzene levels 26,000 times above the legal limit in local groundwater ([royaldutchshellgroup.com](https://royaldutchshellgroup.com/2012/03/29/village-claims-shell-oil-ruined-its-water/?nb=1&share=print#:~:text=Roxana%2C%20a%20village%20of%201%2C550,than%20allowed%20by%20state%20law)) ([royaldutchshellgroup.com](https://royaldutchshellgroup.com/2012/03/29/village-claims-shell-oil-ruined-its-water/?nb=1&share=print#:~:text=match%20at%20L21%20The%20Village,affiliates%2C%20in%20Madison%20County%20Court)). Shell has fought to limit its liability — in 2019 the Seventh Circuit Court of Appeals dismissed a class-action by Roxana property owners seeking damages for the pollution, a decision favoring Shell’s position ([www.courthousenews.com](https://www.courthousenews.com/shell-let-off-the-hook-on-benzene-pollution/#:~:text=CHICAGO%20%28CN%29%20,sue%20Shell%20Oil%20for%20pollution)) ([www.courthousenews.com](https://www.courthousenews.com/shell-let-off-the-hook-on-benzene-pollution/#:~:text=Circuit%20refused%20to%20let%20Roxana%2C,sue%20Shell%20Oil%20for%20pollution)).
neighbors.influence_justification: No active local operations or employment; primarily known for past pollution issues and legal defenses rather than community engagement

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Shell’s environmental remediation team if the project site overlaps any contaminated areas; otherwise, ensure compliance with regulatory standards to avoid provoking corporate objections

neighbors.name: Roxana Community Park District
neighbors.claims: Roxana Community Park District is a local government unit that provides parks and recreation, funded principally by local property taxes and user fees ([roxanapark.org](https://roxanapark.org/mission/#:~:text=Mission%20,user%20fees%2C%20within%20financial%20limits)). The Park District joined Roxana CUSD 1, the Village of Roxana, and others in a 2012 lawsuit opposing WRB Refining’s bid to classify about $3 billion of refinery improvements as tax-exempt pollution control facilities (which would have reduced the district’s tax revenue) ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html#:~:text=HARTFORD%20SCHOOL%20,)) ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html#:~:text=taxpayer,5%20of%20the%20Property)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small taxing body with limited resources; relies on alliances with larger entities to exert influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Meet with Park District officials to explain that the project will not encroach on park land or reduce their funding; offer support for community recreation initiatives to build goodwill

neighbors.name: PRS Properties LLC
neighbors.claims: PRS Properties LLC is a privately-held Illinois property holding company with minimal public information available; it is not listed among known local businesses in Roxana ([www.manta.com](https://www.manta.com/mb_51_ALL_4YZ/roxana_il?pg=3#:~:text=Companies%20%7C%20Roxana%2C%20IL%20,under%20Companies%20in%20Roxana%2C%20IL)). No records of financing statements, litigation, or development activity involving PRS Properties LLC were found in public databases or news archives ([propertyvendors.com](https://propertyvendors.com/realtors-brokers/il/madison-county/roxana/#:~:text=%E2%86%90%20Back%20to%20all%20Real,%2A)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small private landowner with no known community role or political connections

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the LLC’s owner discreetly (identity not public) and emphasize how the project could enhance their property’s value or rental appeal; address any financial concerns to preempt opposition, but significant pushback is unlikely given their purely economic interest

neighbors.name: Madison County Trustee
neighbors.claims: Madison County Trustee holds title to parcel 19-2-08-34-12-204-014, a 35.3 × 120 ft lot at 152 E. 8th St. (Roxana/Wood River area), acquired by the county due to unpaid taxes ([www.scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/document/691260247/Madison-County-Surplus-Property-1#:~:text=1223126%2019,X%20120%20IRR%20MINIMUM%20BID)). This tax-foreclosed property is slated for resale through the county’s Surplus Property Auction process, which sells land where property taxes went unpaid ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/madison-county-recoups-losses-annual-real-estate-18544660.php#:~:text=The%20just,to%20pay%20the%20delinquent%20taxes)).
neighbors.influence_justification: County-held delinquent parcel with no private owner; essentially a passive government role

approach_recommendations.engage: No direct engagement necessary, as the Trustee is an administrative holder of the property; coordinate with county officials if acquisition or site access is needed, but expect no opposition since the county welcomes returning the land to productive use

overview_summary: The development site’s neighbors comprise a mix of institutional and private landowners. Among the three private residents profiled, none have documented positions on development (all noted stances are "unknown"). All individual neighbors appear to have limited community influence (no public offices or major civic roles), while the Village of Roxana itself is a high-influence stakeholder as the local government. All five neighbors have an **unknown** stance toward the development, as none have made public statements of support or opposition. Three neighbors (the Johnsons, Ms. Warren, and Ms. Niemeyer) hold **Medium** community influence through roles in education, local business or nonprofit leadership, while the other two have **Low** influence with minimal public profiles. All five profiled neighbors have no documented public stance on the proposed development (all classified as "unknown" stance). None holds an official role or exceptional influence in the community; all appear to have a low community profile. This suggests a low concentration of high-influence neighbors in the immediate area. None of the five profiled neighbors have a documented stance on development or clean energy, as no public statements or actions could be found. Most exhibit low community profiles, with only one (a retired school administrator) suggesting moderate local influence. No high-influence community figures were identified in this group. All three profiled neighbors have no documented stance for or against development, with each noted stance classified as unknown. None of these landowners holds a high-influence position in the community; they appear to be private residents without public leadership roles. Neighbors consist of major energy companies (WRB Refining – a Phillips 66/Cenovus joint venture, and Shell Oil), a regional fuel retailer (Midwest Petroleum), and local government bodies (Roxana school and park districts). The industrial neighbors are externally owned and wield significant economic resources, while the school and park districts rely on refinery property taxes and have banded together to protect their revenue (generally supporting growth that bolsters the tax base). None of these entities is a pure land speculator or direct competitor in energy development, but the refinery JV and Shell have the financial means to influence or oppose new projects if their operational interests or liability concerns are threatened. The adjacent organizations include a small private real estate holding LLC and a county government trustee. PRS Properties LLC appears to be a minor land investor with no public profile or known stance, likely interested only in property value. Madison County Trustee is a government entity holding a tax-delinquent parcel with no independent agenda, posing little risk of active opposition or support.
